posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked:
Hello, all. I’m hoping to find someone (anyone!) else who’s had this problem and found a fix. I’ve used Signal since 2019.

Ex Husband created an Apple Family Share in 2021 and kicked me off June 2025. When I try to launch Signal now, a popup appears with the message, “This app is no longer shared with you. To use it, you must buy it from the App Store.”

It’s a free app, but, OK.

I head to the app store, it requests I perform an update, which I attempt, and another popup says “Cannot Update App Signal - Private Messenger cannot be updated because it was refunded or purchased with a different Apple Account.” Um, it’s a free app, I’ve used it for close to a decade with the same phone number and Apple ID.

Has anyone else had this happen? I’m getting freaked out because 9 years worth of data is at stake here. The phone is the Key to the Kingdom in Signal Land and I can’t believe Apple / Signal would do this. Thanks in advance to anyone who can help!
I think that’s an Apple issue that you’d need to take up with their support team, since it’s a problem with the App Store.

This is a stab in the dark – It isn’t clear (to me) if you deleted the app and started over with reinstalling it under your own Apple account, or if you simply updated the app. If you simply updated the app, then try deleting it. I would power cycle the device after deleting the app, and then install and try starting from there.

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked: Hi! No, I never deleted the app. I did a restart of the phone and that’s when it started popping up errors. I’m afraid to uninstall and reinstall because I’ll lose all those years of data.

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked: Tried chatting with one of their reps who told me it’s the way the third party decided to implement their app. Very sus. I don’t think they know what’s going on and I can’t find anyone anywhere with a similar experience. Thanks for the reply - much appreciated!

So, of course, the issue is the app is associated with the other Apple Account, and the app isn’t being shared with you now. And the only way to fix that is to delete Signal and install it under your Apple Account. But I don’t see a way to avoid losing the data and starting over. See what other say on that part of it.

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Linked devices still work, don’t they?

I’m not sure if the best plan would be to wait out the cloud backups of signal and use linked devices / secondary phone until then

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked:
Not all devices. My iPad does the same thing. My Macbook works for some odd reason but I’m afraid to reboot it. The Windows Desktop app is functioning just fine.

Is the cloud backup feature on the horizon or still a ways out?

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
The cloud backups are currently in closed beta testing
Then they will be in public beta testing and then eventually hit stable
This could be weeks or months away, I sadly can’t tell you as I’m not affiliated with signal
All I can say is that it’s been closer than ever before

If your windows installation is still running then maybe you could extract some of the chat history that way
Although I’m not familiar with the process

Android would be easier as you could just extract everything from the local backup

Not sure if this would work (and it does require some technical skills), but if you are in the EU, you could maybe try sideloading a current signal iOS build over the installation you have. This could possibly preserve your data, but it’s also very possible that apple prevents upgrading iOS apps via a different source. I have no experience with this.

I’d also recommend waiting for could backups, but if you don’t have access to your iOS installation, it could probably only save the data you have on your linked device. If there is even going to be an option to activate could backups from a linked device…

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked: I’m pretty fed up with Apple’s walled garden in more ways than one. I did find a way to extract chat history from a Windows machine using a SQLiteStudio SQLCipher build. But, attempting to open the db.sqlite file results in an error because the file is not recognized as a database. I haven’t dug deeper than that but will try again tonight. I think I’ll save the Signal directories every day going forward until the cloud backups are made available. If nothing else at least I’ll have copies I may be able to use in the future.

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked: I’m not in the EU but sideloading is an interesting approach. I wish iOS would allow it!

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
I believe signal recently made it possible to restore your full chat history from your phone via a link and sync?
However you probably won’t be able to link a new device if your app is not working at all, right?

Otherwise I haven’t used signal-cli yet but I believe it can be used as a linked device, maybe that would be useful for experimenting

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
something to try is maybe “purchasing” the app from the app store on a device with the same apple account where it’s not yet installed. maybe then you can update it and launch

if you don’t have one like that, maybe you could uninstall on the ipad to do that

although in that case when you regain access, you’d have to link the ipad again and it would have only recent message history synced until cloud backups become a thing (and the app uploads such a backup, which would likely require updating and opening it…)

there’s this which lists similar issues https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007211952-Troubleshooting-Installs-or-Updates#update_ios_troubleshooting

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked:
I thought about getting another iPhone to see if the one-time sync would solve the issue. Since everything is tied to the phone I’m too scared all the data will be lost.

My ex husband got in touch about another matter but agreed to add me back to the family plan so I can retrieve my Signal data again. Once that’s done I’ll ask him to make me the Family Manager and have him quit the family. I hope it works. If not I’ll just throw up my hands and migrate to Samsung. Thank you, AlertSubject. I’ll keep you posted!

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked:
Hi! Thanks for the link!

I do have one Apple device lying around that didn’t have Signal installed. I tried it but it’s so old the app wouldn’t install.

I have one more Hail Mary (My ex husband agreed to add me back to the family plan so I can retrieve my Signal data again. Once that’s done I’ll ask him to make me the Family Manager and have him quit the family.) Hopefully it works. If not then I’ll try what you suggested with the iPad. I’ll keep you posted!

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Glad to hear you have been able to get back into your app
Signal cloud backups coming soon ™️ will be a good next step
Until then a new desktop install should be able to sync all prior conversations and be easier to backup than an iPhone

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked: Thank you so much for all of your help. I really appreciate it!

posts.name: Bella
posts.cooked:
Quick update if anyone is still watching the thread.

I was readmitted to the Apple Family Share and…Signal works again. Something is very wrong on Apple’s side. For now, the solution is to continue in the Family Share and wait out Signal’s cloud backup release.

Still, if anyone else has experienced the issue or knows someone who has I’d be interested to hear about it. Huge thank you to everyone who replied to the thread!

@Bella1 Thanks for the follow up. Always appreciated.

I’m wondering about how it goes for you if or when you eventually download Signal under your own Apple Account, and what you can or cannot do with data from the Signal installation under the Family Shared account. For example, if you are eventually able to backup data on the shared account version, will you be able to restore that backup to the version installed under your Apple Account.

Anyway, please continue to post followups.

accepted_answer.name: AlertSubject
accepted_answer.excerpt:
Glad to hear you have been able to get back into your app
Signal cloud backups coming soon ™️ will be a good next step
Until then a new desktop install should be able to sync all prior conversations and be easier to backup than an iPhone
